ai-patthana22.35:0.2_0: under the influence of the Dhamma: the Protector of the Three Worlds
ai-patthana22.35:0.3_0: He should see that it is in the presence of a prey to see and so on.
ai-patthana22.35:1.1_0: One should not give up resentment for seeing in order to give up repulsion and not seeing; for this is a condition for the sake of repulsion.
ai-patthana22.35:1.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:2.1_0: One should not give up resentment for seeing people of variety and untroubled tendencies. Their cause should be given up by cause and reasons.
ai-patthana22.35:2.1_1: This is the reason why the same thing ...
ai-patthana22.35:3.1_0: One should not give up repulsion regarding development, because of the path to developing, because of not-self in development, because of the path and to practice the rest of the Path.
ai-patthana22.35:3.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:4.1_0: One should not give up repulsion for the development of the mind, nor does repulsion come to be given up by development, nor by means of the causes of desires, because of the reason for development of the paths of the floods.
ai-patthana22.35:5.1_0: One should not give up resentment for the sake of not-self. It should be given up by seeing causes and conditions with no cause or condition.
ai-patthana22.35:5.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:6.1_0: One should not give up without seeing causes and conditions for the sake of not recognizing an offense, nor for the sake of resistance, because of not seeing, with no cause or condition.
ai-patthana22.35:6.1_1: the reason why the objects of construction ...
ai-patthana22.35:7.1_0: One should not give up no resentment for the development of the path, nor does repulsion come to be given up by development, because of the cause, with no cause or condition.
ai-patthana22.35:7.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:8.1_0: One should not give up no resentment for the development of the path, nor give rise to development, be given up, nor by cause, with no reason for development (of the rest of the Paths).
ai-patthana22.35:8.1_1: the reason why the objects of construction ...
ai-patthana22.35:9.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to thoughts of insisting on harming.
ai-patthana22.35:9.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:10.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to thoughts of harming.
ai-patthana22.35:10.1_1: the reason why the objects of construction ...
ai-patthana22.35:11.1_0: Not mental exercisesiveness arises dependent on logic and mental preoccupations, this is a cause for the sake of sustained thought.
ai-patthana22.35:11.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:12.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to placing the mind and keeping it connected. It has no cause or reason for doing the following causes.
ai-patthana22.35:12.1_1: the reason why the objects of construction ...
ai-patthana22.35:13.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to joy in those without rapture.
ai-patthana22.35:13.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:14.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to joy in those without rapture.
ai-patthana22.35:14.1_1: the section on the same cause,
ai-patthana22.35:15.1_0: One does not give rise to rapture, nor does he have the rapture and bliss born of seclusion.
ai-patthana22.35:15.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:16.1_0: It doesn’t give rise to repulsion for mental joy, and those that have no cause or reason for the sake of surmounting of repulsion.
ai-patthana22.35:16.1_1: the section on the same cause,
ai-patthana22.35:17.1_0: One does not give rise to the enjoying of the floods, nor does he have no longer pleasure in the future.
ai-patthana22.35:17.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:18.1_0: One does not give rise to the enjoying of the floods, nor does he have no pleasure in being with no bliss as condition.
ai-patthana22.35:18.1_1: the section on the same cause,
ai-patthana22.35:19.1_0: One does not give rise to repulsion of the heart’s equanimity, nor does repulsion come to an end.
ai-patthana22.35:19.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:20.1_0: It doesn’t give rise to confidence in those without it. That teaching doesn’t give rise to the repulsion.
ai-patthana22.35:20.1_1: the section on the same cause,
ai-patthana22.35:21.1_0: One does not give rise to the shackles of visible in this way. They are conditions for the sake of defilement and in dependence on sensual pleasures.
ai-patthana22.35:22.1_0: Not inappropriate towards the attainment of the impingement, nor doing so by means of non-resultaneousness arises condition for the sake of repulsion.
ai-patthana22.35:22.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:23.1_0: Not inappropriately, not for the sake of someone else, or for the sake of the fine-material sphere. This is a cause for the sake of repulsion of the fine-material sphere.
ai-patthana22.35:23.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:24.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to the scope of logic, or in the formless realm.
ai-patthana22.35:25.1_0: Not in the visible, not in the formless, or in the formless.
ai-patthana22.35:25.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:26.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to the scope of logic, organs to lawfulness, or by repulsion.
ai-patthana22.35:27.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to satisfaction, nor get rid of repulsion.
ai-patthana22.35:28.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to confidence in those without it, nor does he have any response of causes.
ai-patthana22.35:28.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:29.1_0: One does not give rise to repulsion. It does not give rise to unaffection, repulsion, cause, and conditioned by not grasping.
ai-patthana22.35:29.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:30.1_0: Not for the sake of non-decline, nor for the sake of subsistance, because of troublesomeness, for the sake of the untrue Dhamma, and for the sake of repulsion.
ai-patthana22.35:31.1_0: Not for the sake of non-existence, reproaching the teaching doesn’t give rise to satisfaction, with no cause or condition.
ai-patthana22.35:31.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana22.35:32.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to repulsion of insistence on being easy to admonish, and one who has no cause or condition.
ai-patthana22.35:33.1_0: Not for the sake of non-decline, nor for the sake of repulsion, dependently originated, and for the sake of this condition.
ai-patthana22.35:34.1_0: Not for the sake of non-existence, or resentment, because of the lack of impingement, not longing.
ai-patthana22.35:34.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
